org.bm.blaise.scribo.parser
Class BooleanGrammar

java.lang.Object
  org.bm.blaise.scribo.parser.BooleanGrammar
All Implemented Interfaces:
Grammar
public class BooleanGrammar
extends java.lang.Object
implements Grammar

This class describes the supported language elements of a boolean parsing library.

Author:
Elisha Peterson

isCaseSensitive

public boolean isCaseSensitive()
Description copied from interface: Grammar
Describes whether the grammar is case-sensitive. A case-sensitive grammar interprets versions of the same token with different cases as different tokens.

Specified by:
isCaseSensitive in interface Grammar
Returns:
true if the grammar is case-sensitive

Specified by:
parentheticals in interface Grammar
Returns:
an array of length-2 arrays of strings, where the first string represents an opening parenthetical and the second represents a closing parenthetical

preUnaryOperators

public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.reflect.Method> preUnaryOperators()
Description copied from interface: Grammar
Return strings representing prefix-unary operators in the grammar, such as the "-" in "-5", or the "!" in "!true". Order does not matter. The keys in the map are the operators used in the grammar; the values are the names of the associated functions. These functions will be "looked up" in the default class locations, and the corresponding functions should all have a single argument.

Specified by:
preUnaryOperators in interface Grammar
Returns:
a map pairing operator tokens with the method names representing them.

postUnaryOperators

public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.reflect.Method> postUnaryOperators()
Description copied from interface: Grammar
Return strings representing postfix-unary operators in the grammar, such as the "!" in "5!" for factorial. Order does not matter. The keys in the map are the operators used in the grammar; the values are the names of the associated functions. These functions will be "looked up" in the default class locations, and the corresponding functions should all have a single argument.

Specified by:
postUnaryOperators in interface Grammar
Returns:
a map pairing operator tokens with the method names representing them.

naryOperators

public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.reflect.Method> naryOperators()
Description copied from interface: Grammar
Return strings representing all binary AND multary operators in the grammar. The keys in the map are the operators used in the grammar; the values are the names of the associated functions. These functions will be "looked up" in the default class locations, and the corresponding functions should all have two or more arguments.

Specified by:
naryOperators in interface Grammar
Returns:
a map pairing operator tokens with the method names representing them.

multaryOperators

public java.lang.String[] multaryOperators()
Description copied from interface: Grammar
Return strings representing multary operators in the grammar. These should also be returned by the binaryOperators() method, in which there order is used to determine the order-of-operations. Operators returned by binaryOperators() that are not returned by this method are assumed to be purely binary operators. The keys in the map are the operators used in the grammar; the values are the names of the associated functions. These functions will be "looked up" in the default class locations, and the corresponding functions should have a single array-based argument.

Specified by:
multaryOperators in interface Grammar
Returns:
a map pairing operator tokens with the method names representing them.

orderOfOperations

public java.lang.String[] orderOfOperations()
Description copied from interface: Grammar
Return list of operators in order desired for order-of-operations. These should be ordered in a way consistent with order-of-operations. The last entry is the first operator that will be evaluated, and the first entry is the last operator that will be evaluated (and be at the top of the token tree).

Specified by:
orderOfOperations in interface Grammar
Returns:
an array of operators in order of operations

functions

public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.reflect.Method> functions()
Description copied from interface: Grammar
Returns strings representing functions in the grammar.

Specified by:
functions in interface Grammar
Returns:
an array of strings that represent function names
